Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are adding a new field to the SalesTable form.
You must use an extension to add a status field onto the form.
You need to create the extension in the Application Object Tree (AOT) and add the extension to the demoExtensions model.
Solution: Navigate to the user interface forms section for the SalesTable form and create an extension.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content: A is correct answer. Go to AOT -> user interface -> forms section -> SalesTable form . right click and create an extension.

Selected Answer: A
Correct

Selected Answer: A
Correct

comments.content: if the added fields is not in the table, the answer should B, if it is not on the form but in the table , the answer should be A.

discussion.content: The answer should be B, as the new fields will need to be added via a table extension and not form directly.

Selected Answer: A
Correct
Correct answer is A

comments.content: It should be correct, create extension from Application Explorer→User Interfaces→Forms

discussion.content:
I would say: B. No
You should create extension from Application Explorer->AOT->Forms

You are adding a new field to the SalesTable form.
You must use an extension to add a status field onto the form.
You need to create the extension in the Application Object Tree (AOT) and add the extension to the demoExtensions model.
Solution: Navigate to the user interface forms section for the SalesTable form and create a customization.
Does the solution meet the goal?
questions.answer_description:
Instead navigate to the user interface forms section for the SalesTable form and create an extension.
Note: In Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations, the new fields will need to be added via a table extension. Create the extensions on the SalesTable.
Reference:
https://stoneridgesoftware.com/how-to-extend-sales-order-update-functionality-to-custom-fields-in-d365-finance-and-operations/

discussion.content:
Correct is NO: 
https://stoneridgesoftware.com/how-to-extend-sales-order-update-functionality-to-custom-fields-in-d365-finance-and-operations/

Selected Answer: B
Since SalesTable belongs to the 365 application core, it can only be extended.

Selected Answer: B
You need to create an extension.
There is no option like Create Customization so the Ans is No.
correct

Selected Answer: B
There is no Object property for command button. Command button has Command property.

Selected Answer: B
Prollyx explains it well.
Answer is B
how it is B?

comments.content: The easiest answer to that is that the command buttons, while they do have a Command property, do not have an Object property. The correct way to run a report through a button is to use a Menu Item Button and link that to the report's Output menu item.

questions.question_text:

Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are developing a form for Dynamics 365 Finance.
You need to add a button that allows users to run a report.
Solution: Create a command button and link the button to the report by using the button's object property.

Solution: You create the following code:

Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content: Example incorrect because the suffix is _myExtension instead of _Extension

comments.content: and there is not a "next" keyword in the Method extension.
According to the task the method extensionMethodDayOfWeek() is a new method, not an extension method. So there is no need for the "next" keyword.

discussion.content:
I would prefer A. The required method is new, so no next is allowed because we have no CoC here.
To use _Extension is a reasonable recommendation but not requiered.

1. you would need to create a new class that extends SalesLineType and add the method directly to this new class, rather than using CoC.
2.CoC cannot be used to add new methods to a class.

Should be "Yes"
ExtensionOf property correct
Class naming correct with "_Extension"
Method on type "int" and "dayofwk(Date date)" return integer value.

comments.content: An extension class cannot inherit from another class

You need next() when you are changing the logic of an existing method. In this cas it is a new that is being created.
 How i know that? look at the method name: extensionmethodDayOfWeek() .
This is it, it is about the incorrect suffix.
The extension suffix is myExtension, so it is wrong. The correct class name should end with _Extension

discussion.content: Should be A.
State Error ‌ Chain of command method must contain one next call

Selected Answer: B
It's incorrect because fist of all the class has both the CoC attributhe [ExtensionOF(..)], than the "exends" keyword that instead in used fo the overlaing. It should use only one of them

comments.content:
exactly
more reason to be choose answer B

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Severity Code Description Project Path File Line Suppression State
Error The method 'ExtensionMethodDayofWeek' is in a class used for extension methods. The first parameter of a public extension method must be a class or a table indicating what type the method extends. Error Extension class 'mySalesLineType_Extension' must be static and public or internal. Report (USR) [Report ] C:\AOSService\PackagesLocalDirectory\Bin\XppSource\Report C:\AOSService\PackagesLocalDirectory\Bin\XppSource\Report\AxClass_mySalesLineType_Extension.xpp 1

Selected Answer: B
I prefer B, sice the question is about extending a class, not inheriting a class.

The coding is wrong.
synatx is fine.
Code to get day of the week is wrong.

Selected Answer: B
This example is not correct,
although the class is decorated by "[extensionOf(...)]" and the name ends with _Extension, theres is the "extends " keyword wich is incorrect in an extension class (extends is only for derivated classes)

comments.content: It does indeed seem this way

discussion.content: I believe someone messed up the questions vs discussion. The discussions are about a different question.

Selected Answer: B
There is issue with the class name suffix "_myExtension", extension class has to end with "_Extension". Compiler would give you error with this code.

Selected Answer: B
Correct B

Correct is No:
suffix of class extension must be “_Extension” otherwise you will get build error.

The problem is not about the compilation but about the value obtained.

You should never manipulate dateTime to extract the date without applying a timeZone.

In this piece of code depending of the time of the day you will not have the same result (unless you're in Great Britain of course :D).


So B is the correct answer.

comments.content: I misplaced my comment. It will be more accurate on the other piece of code like this one. Because here the _myExtension is false.

discussion.content:
Correct is No:
suffix of class extension must be “_Extension” otherwise you will get build error.
Correct class naming convention should end with "_Extension" and not "_myExtension". Correct answer is B: No.
B - "No". The class name doesn't end in "_Extension"
I agree agree with the comments posted above
I agree, also checked, no compilation errors with this code.
